results.title: France panorama. [No. 72/40]
results.creator_credit: Pathé Frères and Societe d'informations Cinematographiques
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Flashes: Albert Marquet - retrospect of painter Albert Marquet; Chess - where the chessboards and sets for the world championship match were made. 2. Youth and space - the young science students’ clubs launch their rockets. 3. Academician Jean-Jacques Gauthier - Jean-Jacques Gauthier, journalist, critic, and novelist, succeeds Louis Armand in the French Academy. 4. Autumn at Versailles - the famous gardens of Le Notre and the Great Fountains.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 72/39]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Flashes: Walls of Paris - naive paintings on old walls in neighbourhoods which are to be rebuilt; Works of young sculptors - modern sculpture show before the UNESCO building in Paris. 2. Surfing - European surfboard riding championships at Biarritz. 3. Oil prospecting - prospecting for undersea oil deposits. 4. Guillevic, poet - thumbnail sketch of a French poet. 5. European majolicas - retrospect of European majolica work at France’s National Museum in Sevres.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 72/38]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazines items including: 1. A vehicle for the city - experimental use of 20 electric minicars in the city of Dijon. 2. Adzac’s art - relief and hollow casting sculpture. 3. Festival at Arles - the old town of Arles, heart of Provence and the Camargue: The dance - Requiem in Arles by the Ballet Theatre Contemporain; Presence of Camargue - photo show on the Camargue theme; The Theater - the Arcady Company performs “Solomon the Magnificent”; Picasso donation - new Picasso canvases at the Roattu Museum; The modern dance - “hiphop” with scenography by Cesar.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 72/37]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Flashes: electronics and networks - a new system of color visualisation of networks. 2. Reptiles and sauria - snakes, crocodiles, and turtles at La Belle Epine. 3. Soulages 1970-1972 - work of the painter Soulages. 4. The summer fair - a day at the Fete des Loges. 5. Tribute to Diaghilev - commemoration of Diaghilev’s Russian ballaets in Paris.

results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Flashes: Equestrian sport - international show jumping meet at Dinard in Brittany. results.title: France panorama. [No. 72/35]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Flashes: Art and environment - statues and sculptures for new housing developments. Tools for all - everyday tools at Paris’ Museum of Decorative Arts. 2. Freight and electronics - computer-controlled automation of the Orly air freight terminal. 3. The arts - Alberto Burri at Paris’ Museum of Modern Art. 4. The Aix-en-Provence Festival - an annual fesitval of music. 5. Fashions - for autumn and winter 1972/73.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 72/33]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Trip to China - France’s Foreign Affairs Minister, Maurice Schumann, visits Peking. 2. Georges Segal - New York born sculptor, Georges Segal, exhibiting his sculptures in Paris. 3.Space astronomy - Atlas 183 telescope returned to France after its tests with NASA equipment. 4. The surrealists - “The Surrealists from 1922-42” Exhibition opens on the Rue de Rivoli in Paris. 5. The Marais Festival ‘72 - restoration and variety of performances.
